title: Sparse Numberic Vector Class & Operations
text: goal ‘sparseNumeric’ provide S4 class representing sparse numeric vectors - , vectors contain many zeros - turn sparse-vector code HW5 complete, well-documented R package. package stors sparse vectors efficiently keeping non-zero values positions. supports arithmetic operations (ex. addition, multiplication, etc.) dot product directly sparse representation, full vector never needs rebulit. addition basic arithmetic, package also includes useful statistical methods: ‘mean()’ - computes mean vector, counding zeros, without converting vector back dense form. ‘norm()’ - computes Euclidean norm (square root sum squared values) ‘standardize()’ - standardizes vector subtracting mean dividing standard deviation. methods operate directly sparse structure, making efficient memory-friendly. package includes roxygen2 documentation unit tests, proper DESCRIPTION file, Github Actions ensure package passes R CMD check. Along methods, package includes: roxygen2 documentation class methods clean DESCRIPTION file real metadata unit tests written testthat, reaching least 90% coverage passing R CMD check GitHub Actions workflow run checks every push pkgdown website documenting functions

title: Sparse Numberic Vector Class & Operations
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(sparseNumeric)  # Create a regular R vector v <- c(0, 0, 5, 0, 3)  # Convert to sparse_numeric s <- as(v, "sparse_numeric")  # Display the sparse object s #> An object of class 'sparse_numeric' #>   length:5  nnz:2 #>   first nonzeros (pos:value): #>    3:5 #>    5:3  # Compute statistics mean(s) #> [1] 1.6 norm(s) #> Note: method with signature 'sparse_numeric#ANY' chosen for function 'norm', #>  target signature 'sparse_numeric#missing'. #>  "ANY#missing" would also be valid #> [1] 5.830952 standardize(s) #> [1] -0.6949956 -0.6949956  1.4768656 -0.6949956  0.6081211
